@graph.name: The Cookie Rookie®
@graph.description: Easy Recipes anyone can make, that everyone will love!

@graph.caption: Homemade Apple Pie is one of the coziest, homiest desserts I can think of! Fresh, warm apple pie from scratch (with homemade apple pie crust) is the ideal Thanksgiving dessert. This easy homemade apple pie recipe makes it simple to bake a fresh pie for any occasion!

@graph.name: Homemade Apple Pie Recipe - EASY from Scratch {VIDEO}
@graph.description: Homemade Apple Pie is one of the coziest, homiest desserts I can think of! Fresh, warm, and made from scratch, making it the ideal dessert.

@graph.name: Becky Hardin
@graph.description: Becky woke up on her 30th birthday and realized she didn't know how to cook, ANYTHING! She started The Cookie Rookie as a way to document her journey to learn how to cook, one recipe at a time! The Cookie Rookie is a place to find easy recipes that anyone can make, and everyone will love!

@graph.name: Easy Homemade Apple Pie Recipe
@graph.description: Homemade Apple Pie is one of the coziest, homiest desserts I can think of! Fresh, warm, and made from scratch (with homemade apple pie crust), making it the ideal dessert. This easy apple pie recipe makes it simple to bake a fresh pie for any occasion!

video.name: Homemade Apple Pie
video.description: Homemade Apple Pie is one of the coziest, homiest desserts I can think of! Fresh, warm apple pie from scratch (with homemade apple pie crust) is the ideal Thanksgiving dessert. This easy homemade apple pie recipe makes it simple to bake a fresh pie for any occasion!

recipeIngredient: 6-8  apples (peeled and sliced (we use gala apples, they seem to cook the best))

recipeInstructions.text: mix with apples. (I used about 6 apples for my pie plate and only about 3/4 of sugar)
recipeInstructions.name: mix with apples. (I used about 6 apples for my pie plate and only about 3/4 of sugar)

recipeInstructions.text: Line pie plate with pie crust. Then pour sugar coated apples into pie plate. Dot with butter. I used 1/2 or 1/4 teaspoon of butter and just put 4-5 smaller balls of butter randomly on top of the apples.
recipeInstructions.name: Line pie plate with pie crust. Then pour sugar coated apples into pie plate. Dot with butter. I used 1/2 or 1/4 teaspoon of butter and just put 4-5 smaller balls of butter randomly on top of the apples.

recipeInstructions.text: Place second crust on top of apples and butter. Cut a few slits for steam to escape on top layer of crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Place second crust on top of apples and butter. Cut a few slits for steam to escape on top layer of crust.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread a small amount of milk on top of pastry (I use a fork, when I use a spoon the pastry gets soggy.)
recipeInstructions.name: Spread a small amount of milk on top of pastry (I use a fork, when I use a spoon the pastry gets soggy.)

recipeInstructions.text: Then sprinkle pie with sugar on milk. This will give the pie a warm and brown look on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Then sprinkle pie with sugar on milk. This will give the pie a warm and brown look on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake pie at 400 for 50 minutes. I would put a cookie sheet a rack lower in the oven in case juices overflow your pie plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake pie at 400 for 50 minutes. I would put a cookie sheet a rack lower in the oven in case juices overflow your pie plate.
